thread.title: FOOTBALL: Area stat leaders, Week 8
thread.title_full: FOOTBALL: Area stat leaders, Week 8 - Press Enterprise

author: ERIC-PAUL JOHNSON
title: FOOTBALL: Area stat leaders, Week 8
text:
BY ERIC-PAUL JOHNSON / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 21, 2015 Updated: 2:30 p.m. FOOTBALL: Area stat leaders, Week 8 Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Redlands East Valley's Joey Harman is tied for the area lead with 21 touchdowns scored and 128 total points. DOUG BENC, CONTRIBUTING PHOTOGRPAHER Related article Â» Here are the area's high school football leaders heading into Week 8 games.
San Bernardino's Alexander Mattison is the top rusher with 1,592 yards, and he also is tied for the scoring lead (128 points) with REV's Joey Harman and Cal Lutheran's Levi Schriefer.
Carlevon Manuel from perris is the leading passer with 1,818 yards, while Murrieta Valley's Marquis Spiker is the top receiver in the area with 912 yards.
Temescal Canyon's Austin Cuicchi is the Inland area's leading tackler (101) and Santiago's Terrell Sayles leads the way in sacks (12.5). Faith Baptist Academy's Norman Cook, Banning's Gabriel Garcia and Paloma Valley's Blake Bouman each have six interceptions.
